title: Understanding New York State Mathematics Standards
driving_question: How can the New York State P-12 Learning Standards for Mathematics be applied to solve real-world problems?
short_background_context: In 2013, New York State began administering tests that assess student performance according to the new New York State P-12 Learning Standards in Mathematics. These standards require a balanced combination of procedure and conceptual understanding. The tests include multiple-choice questions, short-response questions, and extended-response questions. Multiple-choice questions assess standard algorithms and conceptual standards, often within the context of real-world applications. Short-response questions require students to complete tasks, apply multiple mathematics skills, and show their work. Extended-response questions ask students to complete two or more tasks or a more extensive problem, showing their understanding of mathematical procedures, conceptual understanding, and application.
tasks: Analyze a set of multiple-choice questions from the 2019 New York State Mathematics Test and identify the mathematical concepts being tested.
Create a short-response question that requires the application of multiple mathematical skills and show how you would solve it.
Develop an extended-response question that assesses understanding of mathematical procedures, conceptual understanding, and application. Provide a detailed solution for your question.
pre_thinking_prompts: What mathematical concepts do you think are most frequently tested in the New York State Mathematics Test?
How would you approach creating a short-response question?
What elements would you include in an extended-response question?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on the process of creating and solving your own mathematics questions. What did you learn about the New York State P-12 Learning Standards for Mathematics?
ai_tutor_prompts: Can you explain why you chose the mathematical concepts you did for your questions?
What was your reasoning behind the steps you took to solve your short-response question?
How did you ensure your extended-response question assessed both mathematical procedures and conceptual understanding?
remix_zone: Students could remix this problem by swapping their created questions with a peer for solving, or by attempting to solve their questions using a different mathematical concept or procedure.
